qas.question: What is the business source of the majority of GE's revenues?
In what other country besides the US does GE provide lending services?
How much of GE's revenues is derived from the financial services it provides?
Besides ITT Corporation, which two companies tried to emulate GE, but failed by the mid-1980's?
In what decade was GE founded?
In what country was Tenneco headquartered?
In what decade did ITT Corporation get founded?
In what decade was Westinghouse established?
In what nation was Ling-Temco-Vought established?

context: Since <a2_0>over half<a2_0/> of GE's revenue is derived from <a0_0>financial services<a0_0/>, it is arguably a financial company with a manufacturing arm. It is also one of the largest lenders in countries other than the <b8_0>United States<b8_0/>, such as <a1_0><b5_0>Japan<a1_0/>.<b5_0/> Even though the first wave of conglomerates (such as ITT Corporation, <a3_0>Ling-Temco-Vought, Tenneco<a3_0/>, etc.) fell by the wayside by the mid-<b6_0><b7_0>1980s<b7_0/><b6_0/>, in the late <b4_0>1990s<b4_0/>, another wave (consisting of Westinghouse, Tyco, and others) tried and failed to emulate GE's success.[citation needed]
